Walking distance to great restaurants, Nepali and Newari temples and culture, surrounded by beautiful old architecture and a killer location right in Patan Durbar Square that is filled with so much history. Highly highly recommend and will definitely be staying my next trip to KTM!

We stayed for just two nights in Patan, with our first morning being greeted by the lovely hotel owner for a complimentary two hour walking tour! He showed us all the secret peaceful community spaces, shrines, temples and houses and also gave us a good detailed history of the town and Nepali culture. He was extremely hospitable and so friendly. The food was also so good! (We tried breakfast and lunch during our stay)- especially if you like a lighter meal. All staff were accomodating and hospitable and cleaned our room/ topped up water/toiletries/refreshments even without having to request. They also took card payments which was super helpful when travelling on a budget! Would definitely recommend this beautiful interiors and boutique style hotel.

The hotel was perfectly comfortable: bed, warm shower and airco. The staff of the hotel was so very kind and especially the owner of the hotel gave us an incredibly interesting complementary tour around the old city of Patan! I definately recommand!

Love every moment.Excellence accommodation right in the center of old part I made the right choice to stay here. Staff super friendly the owner gave me a private tour to the old town I learn a lot. He is very very knowledgeable.

Stayed here end of 2019 for a few days at the end of the holiday. Sarita was very warm and welcoming, and a wonderful hostess. When during dinner she starts telling stories, you are guaranteed to stay longer then you had planned, and before you know it your whole itinerary for the next few days is filled with interesting new locations to explore. She is also a wonderful cook, and likes to bring all kind of people together. A few notes about the location: + Very well reachable by (public) transport and taxi, as it is next to the ringroad. + Easy walk down the street to the historic centre + Close to all necessary shops and services. - The rooms at the front of the house are noisy, day and night, due to the ringroad.

column7: your hair is in good hands!!!
column8: I went for the hair cut n color...And i have short curly hair.....The lady took care of my curls really well....the best thing i liked about this place was instead of trying to sell me the products, she just suggested me to forget all the products and go for The coconut oil.. her tips for the hair were too genuine as if she actually cared for my hair instead of those irritatnig people i had met who just would tell me my hair is really bad need to straighten it or use this conditioner or this Hair mousse...i think i would like to visit this place again in future...

column7: Do not go here for COLOR services
column8: all services at this salon are fantastic, EXCEPT HAIR COLOR. I went in with a very clear description and photos of my desired color, which was blonde. I am a dirty blonde and wanted to go brighter. After three rounds of them trying to get the color right my hair is completely damaged and is ORANGE! I was informed that they do not have toner to take the orange/red out. I am completely disappointed and quite sad to be honest. The staff are very genuine, friendly and nice and I think they are wonderful people, but my hair is destroyed and I'm embarrassed to walk down the street. It's really unfortunate.

Rarely have I been in the presence of such genuine love, care, and concern. It went into everything they did here, even the minor details. It was a truly wonderful rejuvenating experience doing a 10 day panchakarma; in many ways it was a rebirth. I plan to visit again.

I have a long-standing interest in Ayurvedic studies and treatment; I deeply appreciate the “regular influence over dramatic crisis-driven intervention” perspective. An important part of the wellness system is periodic panchakarma, an intense 28-day journey to restore your whole person to your original self (physical, energetic, spiritual, mental, emotional). I have previously completed full panchakarma in northern India (28-days) and small periods in Kerala (5 to 14 days); so, I have some perspective for comparison.  Moksha Ayurveda and Panchakarma Center is an amazing place! The treatments are authentic to the historic model and the facilities are a great holding space to do the work you come to do. The staff, however, is what makes this Center a profoundly healing womb. To a person, they are knowledgeable, compassionate, and deeply caring. They are clearly family to each other and support you in your journey of restoration.  For a single treatment, a short-term stay, or full panchakarma, Moksha Ayurveda has my highest recommendation. I am so very grateful for their nurture and support.

column7: I would give more stars if I could!
column8: Let me start at the end. If you’ve never had an Ayurvedic oil bath, you have not fully lived! This exceptional treatment, which is their end-of-panchakarma ritual, is unlike anything I have ever experienced, and I am still walking on air, enjoying a lightness of body, mind and spirit that was my intention and desire when I initially booked the program.  I simply cannot say enough good things about Moksha. A few years ago I’d had a panchakarma elsewhere, but it was not a residential program and this time around I wanted a place to stay where I could fully immerse myself in the experience… and Moksha exceeded all expectations. The first and final word to describe my experience here is “nurturing”. Because Moksha is a small, intimate place (currently only 2 rooms for residential programs although they have plans to expand just slightly to 4 rooms, and many people just come in for day treatments) you are nurtured on every possible level… body, mind, emotion and spirit… and this is the true purpose of a panchakarma, to connect with, purify and heal every aspect of your being.  In retrospect, I really wish I had made more time to do a longer course of treatment, as 7 days really just begins to graze the surface. Regardless, Dr. Padma did a beautiful job of discerning through our consultation what my primary goals and concerns were and addressing them during my week.  The treatments themselves were incredible. They have a staff of practitioners whose caring hearts and hands make sure you are being maximally nurtured during each massage (so many different types!) scrub, cleansing process, chakra healing etc. Even the necessary but more unpleasant treatments were done with ultimate care and there was nothing that felt routine about any of it. Each moment felt as if it was being done and given to me for my specific needs and particular specifications. I felt deeply cared for.  And then there was Sanjay. Each morning I had two hours of personalized yoga and pranayama as well as some beautiful discussion time about philosophy (yoga and life) and as a yoga instructor back home, this was particularly impactful for me. He is an incredible teacher with a wealth of knowledge, but perhaps more importantly, his energy is as warm and pure as it gets. My time with him in conjunction with the cleansing and purifying treatments themselves was exactly what I needed at that moment in time, as I had just come to the center after a particularly impactful spiritual journey and needed the appropriate space and support to help me integrate the experience.  The food… what can I say. It is authentic Ayurvedic food cooked with love, specifically for your needs to nurture you from the inside out. Delicious.  The center itself (treatment rooms, residence, reception, dining area etc) is impeccably clean and the rest of the support staff was also exceptional, helping in any way possible to make my stay more pleasant. On the morning of my departure Sanjay made sure I had food before my early morning flight and some extra apples for me to take on my journey… so sweet. The whole experience was incredibly personal and touching and I can’t remember ever being so attentively cared for in this way.  Leaving the center and in the days following, I feel so incredibly good. The Ayurvedic system of treating and caring for the entire human system… mind, body and spirit… is highly effective if done right. If you are thinking about doing a panchakarma or getting any sort of Ayurvedic care, it is well worth your while to come to Kathmandu and spend your time and money at Moksha, and after being there, I wouldn’t dream of getting Ayurvedic therapy anywhere else. There is absolutely no question that I will be back, and I look forward to it. Thank you Moksha team… you are all a real blessing.

I stumbled upon Moksha Aryuveda & Panchakarma Center when I was living in Patan, and it was one of the best things that happened to me while there. Everyone who works there is kind, thoughtful and attentive. The doctor is very knowledgeable, and designs the wellness programs to serve each individual's unique needs. The massages are fantastic -- I highly recommend one with singing bowl therapy. I did a seven-day panchakarma program, and found it to be healing and eye-opening -- physically, mentally and emotionally. I've done aryuvedic treatments in the U.S. before, and found these to be so much more helpful. No matter how much or how little time you spend here, you're guaranteed to leave feeling renewed -- and like you've found a new family :)
The personnel is extremely professional and kind. T'he location is quiet and clean. Food is excellent.

column7: Best place in Nepal for Ayurveda!
column8: I just completed a 10 day Panchakarma at Moksha Ayurveda & they completely exceeded my expectations. I came in to treat my chronic back pain and nasal congestion, and I came out 10 days later with both of these illnesses cured as well as feeling completely relaxed and ready to conquer the world. Each day, they checked in with me about my progress and did everything they could to make me feel happy and relaxed. They treat you like family at Moksha. Dr Padma is a very kind, knowledgeable doctor and she answered all of my questions with ease and non judgment. The yoga and pranayama exercises in the morning with Sanjay worked very well with my treatments. The massage therapists gave the absolute BEST massages I've ever had. The food was extremely delicious, healthy, and made specifically for my dosha. The treatments I received were all hygienically prepared, using only fresh herbs. Dr Padma did an excellent job explaining all the procedures, describing my dosha, and giving me advice for the future. I highly recommend Moksha Ayurveda for anyone considering Panchakarma. Even if you come in for just a massage, you will not be disappointed. They offer many different packages to suit your needs. I will definitely be back once more before I leave Nepal.
Really knowledgeable therapists committed to find the best way to help you feel better. Fully recommended

How can a small center be a worldclass experience? When all the staff are higly trained and passionate about ayurveda. Over a long period of time, I have done 14 times of panchakarma in 5 different countries in Europe and the far East, and this center is just the best place to go if you are serious about your health. Dr. Padma creates a personal panchakarma-program to your individual needs, make quick changes if nessesary. The therapist are higly trained, supervised by Ram and make sure you are always very comfortable. High quality in massagetables, oils etc At the reception Nirajan welcomes everybody and helps in all matters. Sanjay teach yoga, pranyama, meditation and chakratreatment with such a special insight and healing power I have never tried before. It is a true gem. Do not miss the opportunity to visit this amazing place

Period: July 2017. Length: 10 days.  In short, Moksha are the best. The communication with Moksha via email while arranging your trip is quick, they send you an approximate program and price list per your request. They meet you at the Airport and bring you to the Center. You talk to Dr. Padma and she defines your body type and the treatment program. And the treatment starts. You live in a room right there in the villa. They make the meals on the spot. I was there in July, the “rainy” season with the cloudy sky and the daily temperature of 26 C. Not a bad time to come to Nepal. The Center is a villa with a garden, located in a quiet street of Lalitpur, a satellite city of Kathmandu. Taking into account the dirt, dust and terrible roads/streets of Kathmandu, this may be a plus. Lalitpur is cleaner than Kathmandu. The team are: Dr. Padma, Mr. Sanjay – yoga instructor and Ayurveda practitioner (he is such a cool guy), Nirajan – the manager and arranger of all things, Mr. Ram and two young men, Santosh and Milan – Ayurveda practitioners and masseurs. There are also several young ladies who do procedures to ladies. The cleanliness and hygienic norms at the Center are excellent. The procedure rooms, the procedures themselves, the oils, the towels, everything meets the highest hygienic standards. They take everything seriously: they are well equipped for the procedures and follow some strict rules. Ram, Santosh and Milan are excellent masseurs with strong hands who give the best oil massage. The massages they provide are very intense and tough but you can ask and regulate the intensity at any time. The massages are performed according to some principles which are beyond my competence: the hand movements along flows of energy in the body etc. The massage may last for two hours and even longer. They take it very seriously. In general, the whole team takes their work very seriously. If they do, they do it good. The procedures are lengthy, performed thoroughly, at a price much lower than probably anywhere in the world. The Center provides the comprehensive range of Ayurveda procedures (the list is available on their site). The basis is various oil massages plus daily yoga and pranayama classes. There are procedures such as synchronized 4-arm whole body oil massage and scrub with ginger and rice powder, or a massage with constantly flowing hot oil performed by six masseurs. Another procedure is Netra Tarpana: they pour oil on a patient’s open eyes. Although this may contradict the modern medicine, the improvement for my eyesight is obvious for me. Every morning you also take some minor procedures such as neti (nose cleansing). At the end of the treatment, they sell you some medicines to take home. Not much, not expensive. Minuses: First: the meals are a disaster. What is even worse is that the meals during the diet periods become scarce. You might have to request proper meals or go outside and eat properly on your own. Second: the rooms do not meet the criteria of comfort in the Western standards. One might consider living in some hotel nearby and coming to Moksha for procedures only.

Moksha Ayurveda and panchakarma centre is truly a Authentic ayurveda centre,which is very clean and peaceful place. I was there for my treatment for 15 days and it was a unique experience of my life. The doctor attending me was Padma mam. She is very open to discussion on all issues and explained therapies well on predictable course. She even taught me yoga and pranayam and am used to it these days. She is available there from morning to evening ,she really took care of me and of course she does to everyone else who is there for treatment. The atmosphere at moksha ayurveda is very homely. The medicines are bitter in taste but worth it for cure. I had stomach related problems. The staff -medical and non medical are very good ,friendly and sincere towards every clients. I have almost cured myself there at the moksha Ayurveda centre. I will definitely recommend to my friends and families. God bless !! 👍😍

column7: Lovely visit and human changing experience!
column8: I visited in Moksha Ayurveda and Panchakarma Center last November. First I met the doctor and it was very good meeting. I got lifestyle advices plus yoga and pranayama teaching. In December I spent 10 days there with classical panchakarma treatments. It was once in a lifetime experience and I felt so much better after the panchakarma program. People in the center were lovely and they treated me very well. I got pure and healthy Ayurveda meals plus clean and homey private room (with a comfortable bed) next to the rooftop. All the treatments were very relaxing. I also got yoga and pranayama teaching during the panchakarma program. Now, 4 months later, I'm still continuing the practices because they help me to feel energetic and peaceful.  It was a gift from me to myself that I walked into Moksha Ayurveda and Panchakarma Center. I learned a lot about my body, mind and soul and I had an opportunity to meet genuine people who are like family to me now. They helped me to love myself and share the love with other beings. This place offers healing environment, treatments and meetings for the people who's willing to feel more alive. I'm happy that I went there and I can warmly recommend it for everyone. Go and experience ღ  See you again in full panchakarma session!

My partner and I attended a week-long panchakarma at Moksha in March and what we received was way beyond any of our expectations. It is very rare for one to find people so honestly dedicated to helping one's health holistically, so in love with life and with such warm hearts. The team is competent, friendly and genuinely caring. Both of us have never experienced better massages. My boyfriend is in owe of Ram's skills, for example, but this knowledge applies to all other therapists too. The therapies and food are pure healing for the spirit, body and mind with very strong positive effects. They are both individualized, after a thorough consultation, and are adjusted based on the experience of the guest. The place itself is a small island of peace, perfect for contemplation, relaxation and internal silence. We enjoyed absolutely everything and would love to go back there as soon as possible. Thank you, Moksha team, you are all very special people running a very special place :) Big hugs, Denitsa and Denis

column7: Authentic cooking school away from the chaos of Katmandu hosted by the lovely Shusma
column8: Fantastic Nepalese cooking class, Shusma was so warm and friendly, the setting for the class is a nice break away from the hecticness that is Katmandu. Shusmas runs a project for providing education to underprivileged women and children in l, the fee goes towards this so not only are you learning to cook traditional food but also donating to a good cause. A great day, recipes were emailed over a few days later......18 months later it’s lockdown in the UK so I’ve decided it’s about time I tried them!

Kitchen was very clean and the outside garden was very pleasant. The lesson is great for any skill level, the teacher is fantastic, she explains the how's and why's in detail. The conversation is also great, and you are also given travel tips in Nepal, I recommend you do this on the first days of your trip.

Us girls had a fabulous time at the 2 Sisters Nepal Cooking School yesterday with Shusma learning how to make traditional local cuisine and also learning about Nepali culture. The money raised from the classes goes directly to their NGO which supports young children’s education in rural Nepal. We feasted and had a wonderful morning full of laughs and came home with full bellies ☺️

My Mom and I had an absolute blast meeting Shusma and her assistant & attending this class! The food we made was better than restaurant quality and now that I’m back in the US have been trying these recipes at home which my family is loving! The facility was spotlessly clean, we chose to make a vegetarian meal and it was so tasty and fun. We also got to ask lots of questions about Nepal and we didn’t have to worry about transportation either!

column7: Fun morning learning how to prepare Nepalese dishes
column8: A really great experience meeting Shusma and learning how to cook authentic Nepalese dishes in nice surroundings. I was collected on time at Thamel and thoroughly enjoyed this unique experience. It greatly added to my memories of Nepal. I can highly recommend this fun way to get a taste of the real Nepal

column7: Excellent experience in cooking Nepali food
column8: The owner of the school is super nice and sweet. We first made a booking, however, we could not make it because of traffic jam. Owner soon rescheduled the class for us. Also, transportation is provided from Thamel which saves us from wasting time finding the school. The food is very nice and exotic. Cooking steps are clear and easy to follow. I highly recommend you to go if you are interested in cooking!

column7: Must do in Kathmandu - special time in our trip
column8: Definitely one of the highlight of my stay in Nepal. I learned a lot about local ingredients and ways of cooking but also about the culture. It was a real pleasure to exchange about everything and to see all Shusma's ideas to create positive impact. She really empowers women and she's definitely someone you want to learn from.Time flied that day. The plus is also the ebook sent at the end, I just reproduced a recipe at home and everyone loved it. A must-do in Kathmandu/Patan. Thanks again!

column7: informative, fun, and delicious cooking class!
column8: I had a great time learning to make traditional Nepali dishes; it was a lovely way to spend my last afternoon in Kathmandu. This cooking school helps to employ and empower Nepali women and fund child education; the heart behind the organization really shines through in the one-on-one interactions with staff members. Shusma was able to accomodate my vegan & gluten-free diet and all the food she taught me to make was delicious, with easy-to-follow recipes. Come with an empty stomach!

I’m so glad as an American woman traveling solo that I did this! The course is fun and informative. The willingness to accommodate and teach is easy but totally traditional and authentic! The area is beautiful...a bit calmer than much of the city and it’s picturesque and pleasant within the confines. The food I made, the people I met and the team.... Shusma and Maya and a few other wonderful people made for a hi- lite of my trip! I highly recommend!

A friend and I attended a cooking session here and it was fantastic. Shusma, the teacher is, as everyone says, fantastic and has had an incredibly interesting life. 2 Sisters will pick you up and ferry you off to the school which is in a lovely suburb of Kathmandu. Nestled behind a villa, is the school with a perfect set up. We were not interested in going to someone's house to learn to cook and this is an actual set up where everyone has their own cooking station.  As mentioned, there are a variety of menus to choose from and I found Shusma to be helpful, encouraging, and very patient. Making the very popular Momos is not as easy as one would think.  I definitely had a fun afternoon and would highly recommend this experience. It makes me want to do this everywhere I go, but I suspect this is a hard act to follow. Do yourself a favor and sign up for a class. Shusma really is fantastic and has a down a great job with the school. The fact she is donating some of the funds to programs for Nepali women and children is inspiriting. Truly a must do experience in Kathmandu!

column7: An intimate, genuine taste of Nepal
column8: For me, our cooking class was the highlight of an epic and eye-opening trip. We got in touch with Shusma because we wanted to do something different for the birthday of my travelling companion. Shusma was warm, enthusiastic and completely accommodating of a very severe peanut allergy. We both found the class to be fun, authentic and we learned more than Nepali cooking. We found a kindred spirit in Shusma, and we were fascinated with her drive and sense as a business owner. Whether you are a feminist and aspiring chef, a tourist looking for a deeper Nepal experience or a trekker recovering from a stomach flu, 2Sisters cooking classes will deliver more than you expect. Can't reccommend enough!

column7: Make time for this amazing experience
column8: What a wonderful way to spend an afternoon in Kathmandu! After finishing our trek to EBC we had a week in Kathmandu. Cooking a traditional Newari meal away from the chaos of Thamel was a welcome break. The owner, I’m sorry I forgot her name, was a pleasure. She took time to explain the ingredients and their importance within the the culture and was great to talk to. The meal was outstanding despite my poor attempt at folding momos. Speaking of which make sure to make the chocolate-coconut ones! They’re amazing!!

column7: Delicious Nepali food that I can now cook!
column8: I would recommend to anyone who wants to do something unique in Kathmandu and really experience the Nepali culture! Shusma is a great teacher and goes through every step to make the perfect Nepali dishes. We even went to the local grocery shop to buy the ingredients before, where Shusma showed and explained to me the different vegetables and what they're used for. This gave me a real insight into Nepalese cooking. You are also given so much flexibility to choose the dishes you want to make (starter, main and desert). Finally a percentage of money she makes at the cookery classes goes into Women's empowerment- so definitely talk to Shusma about this as she gave me so much insight into the caste system, gender equality and what it means to be a women in Nepal.

We like our food with a little bit of purpose. This is the best Dal Bhat I've had and the instructor was amazing with my 10 year old - who is curious about food and loves to cook. On top of everything else - it was practical. Which means we can take the lesson home with us. This is one of our favourite classes to date and would probably sign up again just to learn a different menu.
What a pleasant welcome! A cool family environment in a traditional exotic style . I would like to recommend the most to visit here once you are in Kathmandu. #visitkathmandu

I had an amazing time at the cooking school! That day I was the only participant and so it was actually just me and one of the sisters, but we honestly had such a good time! Although it felt like cooking with a friend, the session was really informative and I learned a lot of different tips on how to make nepalese food. It started with choosing a menu made of three dishes, after that we went to a local market buying the products that we needed and then the fun began. First I got to learn how to make the traditional Masala Tea and after our cup of tea, the preparation of the dishes started. We had a lot of fun making Chatamari, Aloo Chop and chocolate Mo:Mo, talking, joking around and laughing. After each dish you can eat the foods outside in the beautiful garden and just be amazed by how good it tastes! Finally, they send you all the recipes of the day and more, so that you can cook them again at home. The place is really clean and I love that they put a lot of emphasize on not trying to waste any food. I left the class with a full belly, good memories and a new friend! I can 100% recommend the place!

My friend and I visited 2 sisters cooking school for a class and it was absolutely amazing! The ladies running the school are so knowledgeable and accommodating. We visited in low season so we basically had a private class. If you’re visiting Kathmandu you definitely have to get into contact with them to organise a class. We learnt so many new cooking skills and learnt about the food history of Nepal

Amazing and unique experience not to be missed. During our travels, the food we had was so delicious, the opportunity to learn how to cook it was not to be passed up.  Staff were helpful, friendly, patient and did the preparation so we could just concentrate on cooking and enjoying the meals (we cooked) in the pleasant  The idea of using the cooking school to facilitate empowering women is definitely worthwhile.  I would highly recommend the class and it was great to see both women and men of all ages participate and enjoy the afternoon.  Can’t wait to try out the new recipes when we get home.

2Sisters cooking school was a really fun and enjoyable experience. Shusma and Sushila were lovely, patient and excellent at sharing their knowledge of cooking local cuisine. We got to choose between 3 menus and ate the 3 course meal we made throughout the class in a beautiful court yard garden. We learnt more about Nepal than just food, and their English was excellent. It was a really relaxed and genuine experience that I would highly reccomend to anyone looking to understand the Nepali food and culture better!

For someone who wasn't quite interested in cooking class & got talked into joining by friends, it turned out to be a great surprise for me. The instructors were super friendly & fun & you can surely see their enthusiasm in what they are doing. We were taken to local market, explained about the local cuisine and later creating & enjoying food in such a beautiful garden under the sun together. This is definitely a unique experience for me during my time in Nepal. Would absolutely recommend the school to friends & family.

column7: So pleasant and useful time spending!
column8: We are what we eat, so It was very nice to meet with nepalian culture by that way. The whole journey was so interesting, now I know the whole process from buying products to making awesome food. Feeling myself very grateful to wonderful sisters it was a real magic. Best way to spend a day in Katmandu that way! Definitely recommend!

We met someone at our hotel who recommended 2Sisters Cooking School to us. I decide to tag along with my wife and a friend. What a great morning! We had a ton of fun preparing and then eating our traditional Nepali meal, and it was delicious. There was even a choice of meals to prepare. The place was really nice, very clean and quiet. The gals teaching us were an inspiration! They are so nice and so much fun! Highly recommend checking this out!

My sister and I spend a morning at the two sisters, cooking, dancing, singing and eating our food in their glorious garden. Best cooking course I've ever done, feels like you're cooking with friends while learning some traditional Nepali recipes. I can highly recommend!

column7: Authentic Culinary Adventures and Great Hospitality
column8: Genuinely, it was one of the most wonderful and memorable experience with 2Sisters Nepal Cooking School. We had an opportunity to discover the real taste of Nepalese cuisine and their ethnic meals. The ladies out there were extremely friendly and helpful. We felt very much comfortable learning and eating with them. Highly recommended.

This is something everyone should do when they're here. The two sisters are so passionate re what they do with personalised shopping trip to get the vegetables, traditional secrets and of course learning to make the momos! You get a choice of 3 menus, the carrot pudding Amazing!!! This school is the one to support as it the finance helps to empower women in employment. Loved every part of this experience!

column7: An excellent cultural event - very original experience
column8: We visited this place for a fun day with friends. We enjoyed to cook with nepali sisters, the food was fresh and tasty and the sisters taught us about food and culture. A definite must if you enjoy cooking!

Utopia has good food, good ambience, amazing hospitality. Its a happy environment place to be. I have always had a great time. Cocktails are amazing, food category's absolute favorite is Mustang Aloo, dessert favorite is Lemon cheese cake.
Me and my 6 year old son had a great time having lunch today. The food was delicious, drinks were great..Mostly my son enjoyed the whole eating experience..

A-la-carte! One of the best places around Patan. The restaurant is located in a calm atmosphere with really soothing decors, artistic set-up and the positive vibe you get as soon as you enter. Order your taste bud- Italian, Nepali or Continental, you would savor and would visit again. Bon appetit! The warm service is quite unique (I would be a spoilsport if I tell everything). Bonne Chance! You can really make things happen if you believe it and you would never miss to visit such an Utopian world. Bon voyage!

The Peacock’s guesthouse is a must stay when you visit the beautiful Bhaktapur. It is perfectly situated in the heart of the city.The authentic ancient wooden craftwork is astonishing as well as the service. Even when we have to leave at 5 o’clock they prepare a breakfast package. And I’ve tasted there the best coffee of whole Nepal. It is a masterpiece and a beautiful fine ruby in the country which makes it for us a must see when visiting Nepal.

column7: Great stay at a traditional Nepali house
column8: What I liked best about the Peacock Guest House in Patan, the bed. It was the best bed I slept in during my entire stay in Nepal. Very comfortable! Peacock is a stylish Nepali house. Decorated in traditional style which I loved. Ceilings are low, so mind your head. It was a bit chilly, but the bed was warm and the shower is hot. Located just a few minutes from the Golden Temple and a few minutes more from Durbar Square. Staff is friendly and will help out. Breakfast was good and there was plenty to eat. I booked my airport drop off thru the hotel and it was organised as it should. Taxi was 500 rupees. I enjoyed my stay very much at the Peacock chain (also Bhaktapur) and I would recommend this place.

In addition to Old House Cafe, I went to Cafe du Temple and Casa Pagoda (all of which are all about 100 feet from each other), and "Old House" was definitely my favorite! No tourists at this one (except me!). The roof area is small,...More

column7: Great food and laid back atmosphere !!
column8: Sun Café has been my lunch spot almost every day for the past week as I arrived in Patan and I recommend everything I tried. Special compliments for the Falafel wrap and the veggie burger !! The music playing adds to the great feeling. Thank...More
The food here, is to die for, perfect for people who want "A real taste of Nepal". Suitable for every taste pallet there is!

Me and my husband love this place. The Indian and newari food here is very delicious, mildly spiced and cooked just right. We come here almost every week. The place is also not heavy on your pocket. The staff here are very attentive, i think they are the star attraction of this place. They would greet you and make you feel comfortable right away. The restaurant has mithila arts all over its wall. The art is a unique form of paining from southern part of Nepal, and always made by women.

One of the best and cozy place to have coffee with organic taste with loved ones, friends and family. With beautiful incraved paintings and peace environment is another attraction. Unique and variation of coffee with phenomenonal taste. While checked in into sanepa Rock Beans Coffee hub can be the best place to spent the time.once is not enough to be @rockbeanscoffee

column7: An Alternative Venue for a Unique Experience
column8: As the name suggests, this art cafe offers multi-cultural choices for the visitors from the art corner to outdoor seating to the lounge bar. Besides hanging out in this community hub, they also provide networking opportunities through events and their co-working space. The prices at...More

column7: Literally the 1st decent bread shop I've found in Nepal
column8: Bread here in Nepal is...heavy, sometimes fall apart dry, often stale. It's hard to find bread that is decent, much less good. But I've gone to Fuji twice in the past week to buy chocolate croissants, banana bread and cheese rolls and I'm more than...More
Nice little coffee shop tucked in the alley of old Patan area. Good coffee & good food. Very friendly staff too. Highly recommended.
Dropped in for a coffee, first floor just past patan gate. Modern clean and the best coffee we have had in Kathmandu/Patan area. Staff great and can recommend...

The restaurant serves you a good Indian food along with the modern gestures of different alcohols. Its good place for a family including old and children. We liked the nan and chicken at this restaurant.

column7: The Best Biryani in the world
column8: My wife and yours truly are eating Biryani and the Non Veg Platter very regularly because it's as good as the original Biryani found in Hyderabad.The people serving us are also world class.

column7: excellent place to chill and eat- great music playlist!
column8: loved the peanut butter smoothie, the cheese fries, and the burgers!! excellent place to take your laptop and work too, as the internet is good. very hospitable staffs, delicious food (even for vegetarians like me), cozy aura (lights, furnitures, art) and heartwarming music :) would...More

Went there for lunch. Vege burger wasn't available. No problem, had a veg burrito instead. Not sure what I ate but it certainly didn't attempt to taste like Mexican food. Leave aside the fact it was served encased in foil which made it instantly soggy (I ate in-house, why serve it in foil and not paper?), it had some Asian sweet and sour flavor, almost like soy sauce. It was confusing. Wasn't terrible so I ate it, but it was disappointing.  Also had fries, which were suuuuper oily but nonetheless crunchy. Average.  Custard filled donuts were also average.  Overall I didn't go out of my way to get there (it's right near where I live) so that mitigated my disappointment a bit. I went there based on TripAdvisor reviews and am still confused why it's rated so high.  To the manager, please raise your standards back to what they hopefully were in the past.

column7: Best Burritos and Burger in Kathmandu
column8: I truly loved the ambience of the restaurant and the immaculateness and service is on point. The food tastes simply awesome and the joy of food which needn't be just about the pure mechanics of eating food but the presentation, flavor and the love of preparing it is truly represented on the dishes itself.

A true find when looking for fast food here. Fast and efficient service, nice eating area and very good prices. There's no ordinary tasting burger or burrito as everything has a bit of a zing with their special tasting sauces and ingredients. A fav with my teenagers. The waffles are amazing and do match up to the nutella stuffed donuts.

column7: Very good Japanese food, pleasant atmosphere
column8: The restaurant is not really easy to find, but in any case worth the trip if you are looking for a tasty, authentic Japanese Restaurant in Kathmandu.  Very nice and relaxed outside seating on a terasse with bamboo roof. Friendly and attentive staff. Good variety of food on the menu. Just about the right amount of dishes to choose from. To cut it short, the taste of the food is really very good, and authentic. I have lived in Japan for ten years and can say, it is also pretty authentic, which you unfortunately will find only very seldomly. The yummy taste is up to the Japanese patron who continuously supervises the kitchen staff in the proper preparation of the dishes.  From what we had we would especially recommend the tofu steak (if you like Japanese tofu), really very original and tasty, however you will not get a big bunch of grilled tofu as 'steak' in Japan..The tempura was coming as a large portion, vegetables and the shrimps were very fresh, prepared in most fresh oil. The homemade udon noodles were nice, but a little bit too soft. Finally try the gyoza. Both, the chicken an the pork (even better) gyoza are extremely tasty!  Eat there and you not be disappointed !

After coming back from State, this is the first time, I visit Japanese Restaurant with friends and family. When I go inside, all old memories make imagination in my brain about Japanese food. Well we tried lost of food there and sofar so good. Enjoy...More

Went here with the fam, the food isn't very unique - authentic Nepalese but the achar (spicy sauce/pickle) offered with the food takes it to a whole new level. There's also an option to buy your favourite achar from the shop located at the gourd...More

Nice, friendly, comfortable atmosphere. Food was delicious, we had traditional Nepali appetisers and dhalbhat combo, selection of drinks and other food options and obviously the pickles were very nice.

If you are looking for authentic tasty Nepali food, look no further!  I am a regular customer coming almost every week and have tried pretty much everything of their very diverse menu. The food has that very authentic taste and offers a very subtle harmony between carefully prepared home-cooked food and delicate gourmet cuisine, with just the right balance of spices. They also serve delicious side achaar (spices) with every meal, my personal favorite being the lapsi (Nepali plum). The quality is always constant, I have never been disappointed a single time. It's probably one of the best Nepali restaurant in town and definitely my personal favorite one!  But it's not only the great food that makes me come back again and again. It is also about the place and its people. The friendly owner and the smiling staff are very attentive and always give me a warm feeling of being taken care of. The restaurant is also decorated with taste and exudes a very pleasant atmosphere. There is a sort of discrete elegance, refinement in simplicity, at Achaar Ghar which makes it a truly special place for a unique culinary experience. A must!

column7: Great Nepali restaurant in Patan area!
column8: Been there for the first time during my stay in Kathmandu and had traditional Nepali cuisine Momo (w/ soup) and Dalbhat. They were exceptionally tasty! Very friendly staff and good service.

If you wanna get some real American food than you must go to this place for the perfect American food and as well as if you cannot go to the place you can order it online. they have the best food for the people who...More

Thinking the food would be super-rich, American-style, we went here on a weekend. No other guests should have been our first clue to run, but we thought otherwise and said 'ah! We have the place to ourselves - exclusive service and better food for us....More

I have been here a couple of time on my most recent trip to Nepal and it's so nice. The food is all western stomach friendly. Local organic and hydroponic ingredients. The water is filtered, you don't have to worry about anything there you can eat it all.  Te staff are very friendly and welcoming. Beer comes in a frozen glass. Great place to eat. Highly recommended!

On a recent Saturday, my wife and I were shopping at Bhat-Bhateni Supermarket at Krishna Galli and decided to walk up to Jhamsikel for lunch. We both had the same thought as we walked directly to the newish Southern Comfort restaurant near Saint Mary’s school without our usual discussion about where we want to lunch.  Southern Comfort’s menu is all American. Burgers, onion rings, Caesar salad, chicken-fried steak, biscuits and gravy. You get the idea. We ordered onion rings and a burger with chilies and cheese. The establishment’s owner stopped by and explained that to get a true American flavor he had to make many of the items we take for granted from scratch. He and his staff bake the hamburger buns, produce their own mayonnaise and home make the ranch dressing. The results are nothing short of spectacular for Nepal.  The onion rings were the first we’ve had during our two years in Nepal and the burger the best we’ve tasted in Kathmandu. Southern Comfort’s got all the American details just right. Our beer was even served ice cold in a frosty mug. Welcome home.

Decided to stop by here on a short visit to Kathmandu. Delightful evening with our hosts, Cass and Sunita. Each dish was prepared carefully and with attention to detail and presentation - they are real foodies! Also, gave us their honest opinion about what was...More

Anywhere, not just in Nepal.  The restaurant holds to a very high quality in service and food quality.  It's a small place, but a few cute tables and chairs set with wine glasses, plates, and cutlery are scattered around as well as two conversation areas with lounge chairs.  My personal favorite is the spaghetti with pesto. It's on the "lunch" menu, but you can order it for dinner as well. This is some of the best pesto anywhere. I've had it more than a dozen times easily. Only once (years ago) was it a little subpar. Every other time it's come out fresh, hot, aromatic, and flavorful!  I also like the Rock Shrimp Tempura appetizer. The shrimp have been frozen, though. (After all this in Nepal and we're very far from ocean!). So if that bothers you, don't order them.  The desserts are great, though I'm usually too full to order one.  The owner is Nepali who has studied abroad. He clearly has an interest in French cooking (and the menu is French-inspired), though he works in information technology. If he's in, you can even order in French (if you'd like). Otherwise, you'll need to stick with English (or Nepali, of course).  They always seem quite happy to see me when I'm in town and stop by. It's a little off the main street, so they don't get a lot of foot traffic. More NGO and UN workers than tourists (it's right across from the U.N. gate in Patan.  Highly recommended.

So glad to have found this place! Tucked down a little side street, Cibo feels like a little oasis of calm. The decor is chic in an understated, inviting kind of way. The restaurant is also super clean (even the bathrooms!). The food was a welcome and delicious break from the hotel food I have been eating for the past week. I had the coconut prawn curry and my wife had the vegetable couscous, both of which were really good. They also have a proper coffee machine, so I was able to have a decent coffee at last! Service was really excellent too. Definitely recommend!

Went there for dinner, and the food was solid. Partner and I had pasta, and his serving size was a bit small. Mine was good, not great though. Craft beer selection is the best we've seen in Nepal, service is fabulous and they have a great selection of delicious desserts.

What can I say? Delicious food, lovely staff and beautiful ambience - a real winner! The pita wraps, gnocchi and lasagna are stand outs, as well as the Oreo cheesecake. We'll be going in tomorrow to check out their new menu, and I'm sure it will not disappoint.

My fiancé and I went to this restaurant last night. It's tucked away in an alley off Pulchowk right opp. the UN Habitat office. We had the entire restaurant to ourselves the whole time we were there (7-9pm roughly). It was so shockingly warm and cheerful that we may not have cared if the food was not satisfying. However, our dinner was absolutely delicious. I am a vegetarian and I haven't had a more sumptuous meal in the last week in Nepal than at Cibo Bistro. Their vegetarian lasagne was probably the best I have had anywhere. The bruschetta had so much flavour; grilled slices of eggplant, zucchini and tomato are layered over bread, and splashed with just the right amounts of basil pesto and mozzarella. My fiancé had the gnocchi with the house wine and some apple pie for dessert (I was too full from the lasagne for any dessert). Coffee was pretty good too. Cibo's service is very helpful and quick.  In short, this is a restaurant that offers excellent and varied food in a decent price range and guilt-inducing comfort in a power-starved city.
Have been frequenting this for past couple of years. Their pita sandwiches are good and love the Aglio Olio pasta. Good deserts to finish off.

column7: True Italian taste hidden in a Kathmandu alley
column8: Excellent taste, presentation, ambiance and service. Really great to find this. HIdden away down a side alley, so you need to find the address ahead of time.
A varied menu catering to most tastes. I can recommend the salmon, the vegetarian options and all the desserts! Lovely bistro atmosphere and friendly service.

column7: Nice rooftop for drinks and snacks
column8: We came in to try the Khumbu Kolsch from Sherpa Brewery (the only craft beer in Nepal, and the only place in Patan we've found it!) We sat upstairs on the rooftop deck, enjoyed cold beer and some snacks. It was a great atmosphere, the service was good, and we could even hear some local music nearby. The food was tasty, we haven't tried the coffee yet but will be going back.

This place is ok for lunch or quick bite. Actually only thing we got annoyed was that service was wery slow. Stuff escorted us for seats and after that we waited over 10mins to get menu. Well to be honest I went to get them....More

A great place to have food in Kathmandu, the place is unique for its team are differently abled. this makes the food and the experience a lot more rewarding and satisfying. the location is a close to the zoo and very easily accessible and provides...More
Over hyped overated as a "place to be" a "place to eat". Poor quality of food, I am quite certain it must b a day old if not more. Everything tastes the same.... blah!

I have travelled the world and have never been served such disgusting, sickening food. The wifi didn't work and the menu was out of date. When It came to paying every price was higher. It's an absolute scam and when I complained about the food we were basically told - Unlucky. Even my ex wife could make better food than this, save yourself the hassle of wasting money on food you will not like and eat a cheesy toenail instead. You will enjoy it much more than the food here.

column7: Amazing food.. reminds me of Singapore..
column8: Good food.. a bit expensive but worth it... Reminds me of the essence of Malaysian and Singaporean food

this is a place to keep in your list for sure. the cuisine is unique, the service very good and fast, the prices are reasonable. we are often coming for lunch there with colleagues. also, they have very good deserts, we may coming there for them only, even...

column7: Ifthar at Sing Ma Food Court
column8: We ordered several appetizer and main course, compared to the original nasi lemak from Malaysia and Indonesia I think less tasty, but that was Ok since finally I can eat it again after 3 weeks in Gorkha :) the roti is good and wontoon also...More

We first tried their snacks and enjoyed them. So we came back for a real meals later on, and this time we were a bit disapointed. The servings were rather small. My dish was a little too salty, my friend's one was a lot too salty. That was more "okay food" than great food. Their "New York style" cheesecake is really good as per Nepalese standards. They don't bring you water automatically, we had to ask each time we went, not so pleasant when you are thirsty and tired on a hot day ! So mixed feelings, but definitively not a "must try" for us.
Amazing artitechture and sculptor of ancient lost newar valley.. Made from terracotta only.. in the patan city where majority of population follow buddhism ..

It is inspired from the Maha Bodh temple in Gaya India. The temple is unique and beautiful with thousands of Buddha statue made on bricks covering the entire temple. You need to carefully look at the directions as it in a alley. Not very far from Durbar square.

One of the masterpiece work on terracotta shikara style Buddhist temple in kathmandu valley that build in 14th century AD. Mahaboudha mean many boudha the temple is completely covered by 1000 one thousand statue of boudha. A group of business men who visited India in14th century and thought to introduce unique terracotta to the people of valley. This temple is located in lalitpur about 15 minutes walk from patan Durbar square to east south inside courtyard. Worth to visit for travelers who love artictecture.

A sight to behold! Even with the scaffolding and repair work, it's definitely a place to take friends. Intricate, historic. There is a very good tea house on one side; I recommend you take a drink to the roof to get a better view of the temple.

When I entered into the area of this temple, I was shocked...really!!! I had never imagined that such temple exist even in Nepal...it is really a unique and beautiful temple. It has 1000 Buddha statues .. A best temple, architecture, design... For me.
10 minutes from the main Durbar Square, gives one a real sense of a working Buddhist Temple. Light a butter lamp and make a prayer!

Especially to Buddhists, this is a holly place for visiting. If you can accept Buddhism, it had better find one who can know Newar Buddhism. The Newar Buddhism is not Tibetan Buddhism but a unique one. It is quite close to the original Mahayana Buddhism.

column7: Tucked away, difficult to find, but unusual temple
column8: Closely surrounded by courtyard, this temple cannot be seen from the street. It is difficult to find, yet well kept and unique, and worth the effort. There is a small entry fee. The temple is made of terracotta tiles, each a likeness of Buddha -It features candles and windows to the interior (another Buddha), interesting architecture. The surrounding walls have inspirational signs - The temples is an oasis of cool air, and refreshingly calm. The same admittance fee enables entrance to the monestary across the street. Directions to this temple can be found on the Patan Durbur square map.

This temple is not in the Patan Square but close nearby. It is a special temple with over 9,000 terracotta carvings of Buddha. I believe the original temple was destroyed and rebuilt after the large earthquake that rocked Nepal back in the 1940's. Some of the rubble was used to build a temple to honour Buddha's mother which is in the same area. It is certainly worth the visit.
It is located near Patan darbar. It is an indigenous market where local handicrafts as well as other commodities are sold.

Must visit place. I was born and raised in and around Mangal Bazar. Oozed history and is like an open museum till date. The architecture and the history is highly fascinating with stories that I love to hear/read even today.

column7: Busting street in the old town
column8: Mangal Bazaar is a treat for people watching. Located in the vicinity of the Patan durbar sqaure and lined by streets of vendors saling shoes to gold necklaces, this place offers visitors a perfect getaway for few hours. You can enter one of many rooftop cafes to get a beautiful view of the square and then step out into the bustling street to explore temples, monasteries, public watertaps, roadside statues, etc. Go west and you will get to Patan sundhara and other heritage sites. Go east and you walk towards the main street of the valley road network. Spend hours exploring and seeing fun things.

In May the touts are elsewhere and life around continues with the same agenda as it has for decades. Very interesting to wander around the lanes and courtyards. The various temples give atmosphere as does the palace complex and the old guys watching the world go by.

This Place love to visit everyday and spend hour and hour over here.This is one of the best palce to be at. This is one of the oldest market. You can see all walk of people over here spending time. Children playing, old people sitting and chatting, youngster chilling.Mainly evening time is good to hang around. People residing over here visit once in day time to catch up friends and collegue. Lots of good restaurant around. Handicraft shop with good statue ritual products and good newari food.

column7: Good place to sit, chat and enjoy!
column8: Its an excellent place; to meet old friends, catch up on each other, listen to music, dance, groove have tons of fun and even have shows and small scale plays and all; food is good too, but I wont say its excellent! But overall great energy, great ambience!
if you are bored of visiting same place thru out the town then u should try this place. never gets old. food is always great and music even better.
A little on the pricey side, but you get what you pay for. The Pizza is one of the best I have had in Kathmandu. While there be sure to stop by Karma Coffee which is right across the way.
The ONLY pure vegetarian restaurant (no onion or garlic) in Patan. Many options, light food, very clean food, good prices.

Beautiful decor, charismatic, great food, excellent service and the back ground music, lovely girl genuine hospitality makes you feel more comfortable and Mahesh is the one, he knows what he’s doing, Highly recommended to visit at least once in your life

We went to have a lunch there. The place was cozy. The food was delicious and fresh. We did not try any Nepalese traditional food but tried snacks. I encountered helpful staffs. However, the food cane very late and my kids were not happy. Therefore,...More

column7: Roast, Grind, and Press your coffee all in 15 minutes!
column8: Beautiful is more than a coffee shop. They have the history, pictures, and explanation of coffee from the plant to the cup in Nepal. I love this place.

On our walking tour to Patan we found this wonderful little café far away from all the traffic. Lemonade, Ice-tea, cookies with peanut and a unique brownie made our day. Friendly employees. +++ clean restroom.

We have visited here several times over the past 6 months and we have never had a bad experience. Quite the opposite; the staff is very attentive, polite and friendly. The menu just keeps getting better and every dish, from appetizers to main courses to...More

We stay only for a break when visiting Patan, stunning view! The staff was very friendly and helpful for us break. I think it’s the best rooftop of the city, the view is from old Patan Durbar square to the Himalayas’ peaks. Unfortunately we discover...More

column7: Casa Pagoda Restaurant is a great place for coffee.
column8: Casa Pagoda Restaurant is a great place for coffee. It's right past Cafe du Temple. It has a much better view than du Temple, it has working wifi, and you don't have to climb as far. It serves meals but not desserts.

Casa Pagoda is one of those places that lives on its location. Perfectly located in the Old Town with a roof terrace its a must to go and see. The beer is cheap, the staff friendly but the food is strictly limited - don't do the International food stick to the Asian and its fine. It's great for people watching and drinking beer and then having food

column7: Very bad food quality good location though
column8: We ordered grilled fIsh and we couldnt figure out if that was fish or not. Pizza was equally strange: we thought it was microwaved frozen 5inch one!

column7: the location is very fantastic with view of square
column8: this place is inside the heritage site of patan durbar square and have a every single momemt view of square . the restaurant have a nice food with beautiful coutryard where one can have good taste of espressos ...

column7: Authentic roof top restaurant in Patan
column8: This restaurant is nicely situated on the roof top of the Lumbini Heritage Home in Patan. It overlooks a quite and peaceful square. We enjoyed a superb breakfast and a tasteful, freshly prepared dinner. The staff is eager to serve you well and adds a...More

Located in Patan Durbar Square, heritage site serving the local NEWARI Cuisine. I had been there 5 years back with friends. The food is delicious. Bara, Chatamari are prepared live. I often visit Nandini Food Court the food are amazing.

column7: Much better option in the neighborhood
column8: My 2 nights at Cafe de patan weren't a nice experience at all! Their cheapest room (870 Npr a night) has a window overlooking the cafe. It was noisy and smelt cigarettes up until in the room. The first night people organised a private party with loud music on and the second night people chatted until past midnight. I was not told about this when I booked my room. There seem to have much better alternative options in the area.

I'd say only the view was good! Ordered chocolate milkshake, lemon tea with honey and sikarni(wtf name). Had to throw everything. The staff doesnot have any knowledge about what the dish is about, absolute zero knowledge. Milkshake felt like a powdered drink. Sikarni, something I...More

column7: Good for a break in Patan
column8: The main attraction here are the excellent views of Patan's Durbar Square that you get from the shady rooftop. The food - I ordered the nepali traditional set - was good, but service was quite confused: we didn't get our momos until we ordered our check. In all, a good place to stop.

Just had my 5th massage at this place by Jima who is an excellent massage therapist and much stronger than she looks! I've had back pain and leg/knee pain for many years since ligament reconstruction surgery in the UK, so try to come here every month. Very happy that I found a simple, but honest and good place for massage in Kathmandu/Patan. Both therapists here have great training. Highly recommended.

Just had one and a half hours massage with Familiar the seeing hands clinic. He was brilliant and found and put right the sore spots. Have the foot massage it is the very best and will set you up for seeing the historic sights of Kathmandu. I cannot recommend it highly enough!

I have a appointment with Ramji for the second time and it's a good, deep massage that works on my old muscle injuries on neck and shoulders. His skills and the flow really helped me to loosen up some of my long term sored spots and knots. It's a therapy that would heal definitely. Highly recommended.

Swastika and Ramji are first of all extremely sweet and welcoming when you arrive in their center. But once you lay on the massage table, the real magic happens! I've had a 90min Swedish massage, it is deep (you can ask for more/less strong) and relieved me from all my long lasting tensions. A real excellent and personalized massage. I can't recommend enough this place!

Seeing Hands Clinic Patan is a must visit to all who visit Kathmandu. They have now moved to a new location a minute away from their old location, right across from the Norwegian Embassy. Both Ramji and Swazi offer excellent massage therapy. I'm a photographer and my back is constantly strained from carrying heavy equipments all day, I recently visited Ramji after having migraines due to fatigue and muscle pain, Ramji was able to alleviate my back and neck pain after an one hour session and I'm well enough to start work again. Will be going back for more correctional therapy. Thank you Ramji!

This place is quiet & simple but the most experienced masseur I've had the pleasure to have work on me for 90 mins. I had the sports option as I really needed a good massage & what a great choice! Ramsii new exactly where I needed more work without telling him & applied perfect pressure everywhere. Very experienced masseur & I came away feeling great as he had worked all the knots out of me ( not an easy task ) He was easy to talk to, spoke good English and had a great sense of humour. I will definitely be visiting here on many more occasions. Please give it a try , you will not be disappointed!

Very affordable compared to the states. 90 minutes of pure bliss! I have worked at a spa in California fir nearly 4 years and have recieved many massages from a wide range of experienced and licensed therapists, some who have been practicing for decades. My session with Ramji was no contest the best massage I have ever recieved. Deep, specific, intuitive. Absolutely amazing. Im going back this week! Thank you Ramji and Seeing Hands.

Thamel is full of garbage and dodgy massage places. Seeing hands is not only a great idea and practice, but also the masseurs are true professional therapists. I had the sports massage and without mentioning where I was hurting, the therapist went right to work solving my problems. For an hour he worked on my shoulder which has caused me trouble for the last 6 months from rugby. Today I feel amazingly better. I will be going back every day for treatment. 1800 rupee. Bargain!

Been going to Seeing Hands for a loooong time, because that is what real massages feel like rather than just rubbing oil all over you. After a stressful week or an intense trek, they just make all the pain go away. The masseurs themselves are genuinely welcoming, witty and interesting, having talked to them is a nice plus for the massages.

What a perfect way to get out of the stress of Kathmandu! The staff were genuine as well as excellent at their jobs - I left feeling rejuvenated and refreshed. Highly recommended for anyone needing to get rid of stress headaches or just for a break from the traffic.

Great little spa, very good massage, great cause. If you're looking for a massage look no further. Unique experience. Rode there on my bike, safe area, tough to find at first but the gate has a sign by it.

I have just been to the Seeing Hands Clinic yesterday and I am very happy I went there. I made an appointment a few hours earlier, but I suppose it is also OK to just drop in.  The clinic is in the top floor of a building near Hotel Himalaya and the Swedish Embassy, quite easy to find. Everyone was very welcoming when I arrived and it is a very professional place. Lulu was my masseur for the day. She is a really friendly and open young women. I could relax easily when she started the massage. I had a full body swedish massage. She kept asking from time to time if the pressure was alright and asked me to honest about this. She worked her hands around my many knots at my back and even found a blockade that hardly any masseur found so far (just my physical therapist at home). After the massage I felt much more at ease though my neck was still hurting. Today, not even 24 hours later, I feel so much better and relaxed thanks to Lulu and her magical hands.  I actually found it quite difficult to find a decent place to go for a massage in Kathmandu. It is quite different from places like Thailand where it is somehow easier and also a litte less expensive. But I am very happy to have found the Seeing Hands Clinic and to have met Lulu. I am surely coming back for another massage with Lulu.
One of the oldest standing Newari Temples. Ancient and Holy place and popular Bagalamukhi Temple is adjacent

column7: Heritage temple next to Darbar Square
column8: This is a UNESCO World heritage temple located next to the Darbar. I liked the crocodile faced water taps.

You have to walk through the narrow lanes of the inner old city of Patan to reach this place. You'll get to experience the old culture of Patan. All 3 cities of Kathmandu valley (i.e. Kathmandu, Patan, and Bhaktapur) oozes the old Nepal. A must visit.

column7: The tall and graceful temple looks out on a busy area of people and pujas.
column8: A decent walk from Patan Durbar Square is a corner compound which contains some empty tanks and several temples, including the Khumbeshwar temple. The temple is dedicated to Shiva and at least part of it is more than 600 years old. The tall and graceful temple looks out on a busy area of people and pujas. It's surrounded by what appear to be apartment houses and seems to be used as a playground for local children.

A Shiva temple with two ponds whose water is believed to come from Gosaikunda is a UNESCO World heritage site. Located north of Patan Durbar square, this temple had 5 storeys with intricate woodcarving. Due to the earthquake, the tower is leaning precariously. A large Nandi statue is still visible.

We visited this during our Nepal trip in December 2010.This is an ancient five-story temple dedicated to Lord Shiva showcasing Pagoda style architecture which is popular in Nepal. Worth a visit when in Durbar Square, Patan.

this is one of the only two 5 floors pagoda of Nepal. it dominates a large courtyard, rising from a not very high row of steps. it is dedicated to Lord Shiva ,silently workshipped as usual by the bull Nandi at the entrance. the woodcarving is impressive and elegant, the pool at the left is filled with water during a special festival (about july),when hundreds of jankris (shamans) gather here for praying and performing devotions during the night. a small shrine is taken in the center of the pool and unique rituals and plays are performed since very old ages. if you continue to turn left,you see a small shrine alwyas filled with water coming,as the legend says,from the holy lake of Gosaikunda. there are other small altars and statues,some very ancient,around the main pagoda ,and a Kali Mandir with a splendid altar with a masterpiece of silver decoration,but unfortunately the walls all around have been covered with white tiles,never cleaned,and the total effect is weird.

good opportunity to see a true religious life of Nepali people. Many saddhus and believers making offerings. Today much more clean, and a much more pleasant experience than a couple of years before. A must-see in Patan!

The owners are excellent hosts and the home-made food is superb (the fresh bread is a real treat). Room accommodations are comfortable and clean. The location is within walking distance of historical sites in Patan.

column7: The beating heart of peaceful Patan Magic.
column8: Hi to everyone that's reading this! For me, Durbar guesthouse has been like a secret base camp for my Nepal travels. I've been selfishly keeping info of the place to myself & some other travellers with similar kind of interests. My motivation for this has been to do my own share of keeping bigger crowds away from the block. I've always liked peaceful & original places, compared to tourist ghettos in developing countries that ARE (arguably) ALWAYS THE SAME PLACE. Same crammed neon-coloured streets and campy manipulative hawkers in every corner trying to sell that So-Unique thing (shawl, shirt, tea, trekking stuff, drugs, rickshaw-ride, you name it) with the special price Just-For-You. All stuff so-like-back-home (Why your'e traveling in the first place dude??) & comfy to pamper

This momo fast food is as infamous as a thawed industrial burger. The real taste of Nepali dishes is in the traditional local cuisines. This commercial chain did not choose the culinary pleasure to sell itself.

I visited bota thinking that the momos will be tasty and good but just opposite it was frozen momo witb lota of sand particles, tasteless super expensive, it is not a place to go and eat and i dont recommend it for its price and...More

column7: The best way to experience Patan!
column8: This was my first time doing a homestay in Nepal, and I count myself very lucky for having made this choice. My stay with the Shakya family made all the difference in my experience of this city. They are a kind and caring family that do everything they can to facilitate your stay with them and your experience of their city. For example, I have some unusual dietary restrictions and was concerned about having them accommodated, but they have had absolutely no problem observing those restrictions (their cooking is fantastic, by the way!). Furthermore, they took account of my interests in Buddhist art and history and connected me to members of the community who could speak to those interests -- needless to say, I learned a lot! If you want to experience contemporary local Patan

column7: Stay here for a more authentic, local experience.
column8: The stay in the homestay is a whole different and unique experience. You get to experience living in a local home, interacting with the local, learning how to cook the dishes and eating the way locals eat, definitely priceless. My host and her family are very accomodating, I can't thank them enough for taking such a good care of me. And, Patan is a great place away from the hustle and bustle of Kathmandu. I truly enjoy my stay in Patan Community Homestay.

Great value for money - I can stay there forever! It's simple but it's got everything I needed - spacious room, comfortable bed, effective heater, hot water, a well-equipped shared kitchen, unlimited drinking water supply, etc. My favorite part is the hosts' hospitality! They helped me with taxi arrangements and provided me travel tips. The location is also prime - close to everything but a block away so it's quiet. I liked the lovely balconies as well. The driving route google maps suggest from the airport to the guest house is not very accurate. The last part of the suggested route is actually too narrow for a taxi to pass so my driver had to ask around to find an alternative way. Maybe guide the taxi to Patan Dhoka (a white gate) and go from there.

Hiranya Guest House epitomizes the very soul of Patan and the Newark tradition. The family-run guesthouse encompasses three generations how's alertness and helpfulness seems limitless. This traditional home built after the 1930s has survived countless natural disasters and gives the average traveler an insight into the traditional Kathmandu lifestyle. And they serve good coffee.

I can simply say about this Guest House is, SIMPLE, CLASSIC, ANTIQUE AND HOMELY ENVIRONNMENT. Classic and treditional furniture and the equipment inside the room are the most impressive parts of the Guest Hotel and since this Guest House is situated in the middle of the local community, I felt like I am staying at my relatives not in a hotel.

I stayed at Sayami house for 5 nights. The room is new, well designed, clean and spacious. The bed....well sooo comfortable! The owner are very polite and helpful. Had breakfast in the morning, they also offer meals. Conveniently located to explore all of old Patan, 10 mins walk from Durbar Square, nestled in a quaint neighbourhood away from the hustle and bussel of the main road. Will stay again if in area and highly recommend

This place is really incredible. Near the historic Patan Durbar, shops, and cheap restos. Perfect for your getaway. Also, the owners are really amazing people. They treat you like family. You won't regret staying here.

column7: Nice quieter inn, friendly staff, wifi unreliable
column8: We stayed here for 1 month as a start to living in Kathmandu. We rented a 1-bed apartment that is owned by the Black Pepper Group however serviced by their guesthouse staff (the building is adjacent to the guesthouse). Firstly, the staff did warn us before we rented the apartment that it was basic--this was the case but it had the space we needed (we intended to stay at the Summit Hotel however there wasn't space available at that time). For the price we paid, it was reasonable however we wouldn't recommend this apartment (the basic kitchen was mouldy inside the cupboards and fat constantly dripped from the vent above into the food pans cooking on the stove; among many other issues). Having said this, the actual Guesthouse has a nice atmosphere and the rooms (shared bath)

I was at Indsu home in July 2021. I had a pleasant stay in their tastefully done rooms. The hosts were very friendly and helpful throughout my stay there. They have a superb restaurant with a nice selection of food on the menu. It is centrally located with easy access to world heritage sites and other places of interest in Kathmandu. I am definitely coming back here on my next staycation.

Here’s my heartfelt appreciation to the team of the patan house. It was my first visit to their newly renovated traditional Newawi house. But actual it was a modish boutique hotel with all (just right) amenities. It was randomly found at the Airbnb, but never thought of their genuine services in these days. I was touched by their authentic hospitality, I feel safe and comfortable with their 24/7 reception, for me that’s really something extra to find in Kathmandu. It was a truly joyous hotel experience. I received a very lovely breakfast every morning, nice gestures from housekeeping, is everyone have good manners from their hearts. Frankly, beautiful house with beautiful spirits! Thank you again to Santosh and Arina for all your thoughtfulness and genuineness during my stays

Patan House is beautiful, maintaining lots of original charm and character while having many high quality updates and decor you might find in a 4-5 start hotel. This was without a doubt one of the nicest places I stayed at during my trip in Nepal. I only wish I could have taken more advantage of it, having only had time for a great shower and an excellent night's rest in a very comfortable bed. I remember it being quiet, probably because it is set off and buffered from the street a little bit, while at the same time being in a perfect location in the heart of Patan. The manager and staff are very warm and friendly. I would love to stay here again.

Comfortable and cosy stay in a very well renovated old traditional house. The property gives you a feeling of living back in time with all modern amenities. This unique place is a perfect location to explore as it's only a stone's throw away from Patan Durbar Square. The house is a traditional Newari house and very beautiful, the staff is friendly and helpful and the rooms clean and spacious.The restrooms are exceptionally big and good, a surprise when you look at the building. If you love to live within a traditional surrounding with local, this is going to be a great place. The hosts are great.

column7: Ring The Bell If You Were Unhappy
column8: The bell sits opposite the palace on two stout pillars and was erected in 1736 to allow the peasants to tell the king, by ringing his bell that they were not happy. An email may have been more private but good on King Vishnu Mala for providing the facility although no one has said whether he listened. He created an interesting relic of the past.

column7: Beautiful Unesco World Heritage Durbar Square in Patan
column8: Amazing square which is one of the Unesco World Heritage in Nepal. So much to see and absolutely everything is stunning. Very highly recommended! Be aware that some of the buildings are under renovation at the moment.

Interesting monument in Patan. Opposite the Royal Palace is a huge, ancient bell, hanging between two stout pillars, erected by King Vishnu Malla in 1736. Used to alert the king by general public for their grievances, and for various warnings.

column7: Huge Bell at Entrance of Patan’s Durbar Square
column8: Just past the south entrance of Patan’s Durbar Square on the left side is a huge bell hanging between two columns. You would need to look up since it is mounted on top of a one-story building. This bell was erected by King Vishnu Malla in 1736 where people could ring the bell to alert the king of their grievances.
The setting and ambiance was pleasant..Caring service and attentive. Innovative trendy decor and the food was close to the true Thai you get in Bangkok.

column7: Excellent Thai taste of food and qualified servers...
column8: Seriously if you want to have the real taste of Thai food I would really suggest you Mango Chili Thai Cafe. This place is cool to have Thai meals. The cuisines here are delicious. The servers here are very talented. They will surely satisfy you with their service. Thank you for providing such good meals... Good luck..

First visit and i am satisfied. The food was good. I had ordered the North Eastern set which was of decent proportions and of value for money. Although i would have preferred the chicken to be boneless and more grilled it neverthough tasted good. I totally loved the papaya salad that came along in the set. One of the best i have had in a very long time. The ambience is very modern and i just wished it would have reflected more of traditional Thailand. Nevertheless it is a good place and i would definitely visit again.
