His local knowledge was outstanding, providing unique cultural insights that added a personal touch to the trip. I would not hesitate to utilise Shambu as my guide on future treks in Nepal.

column7: First time Trekker and we did EBC- Challenging but worth it!
column8: Trekking Guide Team Adventure made the experience unique and unforgettable. Booking was easy and Kabi is very responsive to any queries before arriving to Kathmandu.  We were assigned Kris as our guide (who is very experienced and has been trekking this course for roughly 37 years) and he took great care in making sure we had a great experience during the trek. Any concerns we had were addressed and he made sure that everyone made it to EBC in a very safe and comfortable way. He also made sure we were mentally prepared for each walk and that we ate well (especially for me, as I lost my appetite due to altitude). The accommodation were all booked in tea houses which were comfortable for us trekkers, it added to the experience as most nights we were in the main room playing cards and sharing stories.  We had a few extra days and booked the Chitwan Jungle Safari which added to the fun and wonderful experience in Nepal. I really recommend this if you have a few days to spare.  I'm truly thankful that we booked with the team as it was stress free and they took care of everything that needed to be taken cared of. I'll never forget this experience, it's once in a lifetime. I will be booking through them on my next adventure to Nepal.

column7: Great experience! Best tour and guide ever
column8: Kabi and his team are very experienced in organising such trekking tours. I highly enjoyed the time that I spend in Nepal with my two friends. They were flexible with our schedule and ensured that the itinerary was up to our standards.  Not only do I highly recommend this company, but I highly recommend the guide that we had too - Shambu. He was quite honestly the best guide that we could have asked for. A deeply knowledgeable guide who knew boat loads of the country, its history and its culture. He was also very experienced on the trek, knowing how to tackle certain things, keeping our schedule organised and making sure nothing went wrong. A truly kind and compassionate person - always putting his guests before him. Again, if you do book through this company, I'd recommend requesting for Shambu because he is the best guide ever!

Trekking guide team adventure created an amazing experience for me and my two friends. Kabi is organiser was able to fit our requirements very well. We had a tight schedule but the dates were able to line up perfectly! The guide Shambu made the trip 1000 times better. He is extremely knowledgeable and was able to answer all our questions about the history and culture of the mountains. He was very friendly and well connected with the locals meaning he was able to get us rooms when others were sleeping in tents outside. He also knew airport staff and made sure we were able to get higher priority on flights. His priority is always his guests and made sure to always check if we were comfortable. Shambu is the best possible guide you can get and make sure you ask for him when you do this trek!

We were a little apprehensive in booking this trip and wondered whether we were fit enough, both being in our 50's. We found the company (TGTA) to be very professional and experienced and answered all of our questions promptly before setting off. Our main guide Kris has decades of guiding experience and was able to determine the level of attention and care required for each of the 10 trekkers in our group. The trek is arduous and does require a certain level of stamina and fitness to achieve the end goal. We did very limited pre-trek training and would have benefitted from a few weeks or months in the gym (squats and leg strengthening would have been most helpful), nevertheless we endured and conquered. We thoroughly recommend Karbi, Krishna, and the wonderful porters who helped to make our trip enjoyable and memorable. We should also acknowledge the wonderful Nepalese people who are trustworthy, friendly and helpful and reliant on the tourist dollar for their survival. Keep up the good work guys, we hope we can return to your beautiful country someday soon. Best Regards Stuart and Jacque.

I completed the 12 day Everest Basecamp trek with family members in March / April this year. Kabi and the team in Trekking Guide Team Adventure organised everything for us including airport pickup, hotel accommodation in Thamel (the main tourist centre), a city tour of Kathmandu before we started hiking and all the logistics of the trek itself. The EBC trek is quite challenging but massively rewarding in terms of scenery, wildlife, camaraderie, culture and a bit of craic in the tea houses after long day hikes. Our guide Shambu was very professional, funny, entertaining and an all round legend! He organised absolutely everything including airport transfers to Lukla, meals, accommodation, porters for our heavy bags and the best photo opportunities. Shambu knew every single mountain in the Himalayas, including their heights! His English is excellent and he spent every hour of the day making sure everyone in our group was well fed, comfortable and most importantly, SAFE! I cannot say enough about the man - he was a hero and made the trip an absolute pleasure!  We had 3 porters between 5 people to carry our heavy bags for the 12 days - the lads were great and it was incredible how they ran up and down the steep trails at high altitude with a 25kg bag each, yet never seemed to get tired. All the while, we were gasping for breath! If you are thinking about taking on the EBC, Annapurna or any of the other Himalayan treks, I would highly recommend Trekking Guide Team Adventure.

My second time using Trekking Guide Team Adventure in Nepal. Very well organised and successful trip to EBC and Kala Patthar. Thanks to our great guide Mr. Shambu Basnet he made our trip extremely enjoyable and most of all successful. We all got there with ease and comfort including my 68 year old father thanks to Shambu. Shambu enjoyed our Irish banter and provided great security, knowledge, history and laughter. Highly recommend this company and you will be very lucky to trek with Shambu. Also many thanks to our porters Rabin, Padam and Mantho who were always there to help with a friendly smile. Thanks 🙏

I would recommend this visit for singles, couples and families. The professionalism and care shown by all the team was second to none.  Our guide, Shambu Basnet and our porter dham Bahadur Rai went above and beyond expectations during our trip. Shambu has a bank of knowledge about Nepal, from its mountains to its flora and fauna. He taught me some key Nepalise phrases and some traditional card games.  The accommodation was clean and of a high standard. The owners of the tea houses being very kind and welcoming.  Having done minimal training before the trek I was concerned about my potential success to reach EBC but having such a supportive core team made the goal manageable.  Thank you so much team!

Always had a wish list of visiting Nepal and trek to the Everest base Camp of the world's tallest mountain. After researching for the best and local trekking company in Kathmandu, Nepal I came across to Nepal Hiking Adventure. I found them were very honest, kind and helpful. I came to Nepal alone but there was a person from the agency who dropped me to my hotel. Later, he took me to his office and I came to know he was my guide for my trip to Everest Base Camp trek. This am a solo travelers but I was requested for group join trek for EBC, NHA has prepared a small group of people from different world, it was a great to meet different people for the trek. We had a small meeting with Bishnu, the managing director and Ram our tour guide. Bishnu brief everything regarding the trip. After that, Ram suggest me best cafes and restaurants nearby my hotel for tasting authentic Nepalese cuisine. Since, I visited Nepal alone they introduce me to wonderful groups of people around as well. Trekking with them was just amazing. We all were visiting Nepal for the first time as well as trekking in Everest but our tour guides and porters make this trip easy, fun, exciting and very memorable. I was truly amazed by our porters Chiring and Lakpa, they were carrying heavy loads of bags on a steep rough pathway whereas we were getting breathless even we were carrying a light backpack.  Throughout the trek, we talk about our personal life stories and learn a lot things about this region. The views from Everest Base camp and Kala Patthar is beyond any imagination which gives you the feelings that Heaven exists in the form of Himalayas. A big thank you to our guide, porters and other Nepal Hiking Adventure team for making my journey everlasting. I will never forget this adventurous journey I took with an amazing group of people. I suggest people to take physical and mental training before starting this trek as it can be very helpful while trekking long distance. I can’t forget this especially at last I would recommend Nepal Hiking Adventure to those who wants best services as this company truly offers high quality services.

column7: Amazing views,best organised tour I've been on!
column8: I went to Nepal over the Winter break and it was such an amazing trip. The trip organiser Bishnu made everything so convenient and easy from start to finish. From the initial email he helped plan the trip tailored to what my friend and I wanted. The hotels were really beautiful and the food was amazing. We went to all the main tourist attractions in Kathmandu,we hiked to and from Naktapur as well as stopping off at an old temple, as well as having the traditional Nepalese meal and party it was very cool. Overall it was a brill trip and the tour guides and organiser were brilliant throughout the whole trip. I would HIGHLY recommend using this company.

column7: Done tours all over the world, this was the BEST!
column8: I will cut straight to the point; the tour I have just completed with the Nepal Hiking Adventure Company was the most organised, fun, enjoyable and reasonably-priced tour I have ever been on and likely to experience. The tour organizer (Bishnu) had everything arranged perfectly and in just 6 days we saw all the highlights of Kathmandu (temples, markets etc), went white-water rafting, stayed in the jungle which included an elephant ride, a canoe trip on the river and a trek through the jungle, a cultural dance performance, a hike up Nagarkot with sunset and sunrise views of the Himalayas, a tour of the amazing Bhaktapur and finally a night at a traditional Nepalese restaurant tasting some of the delicious local dishes. Simply amazing. I can not recommend this company and Bishnu high enough. The perfect tour guide and company.

column7: Professional, Attentive and (quite literally) Life-Savers -- SUPERB.
column8: My father and I went with Nepal Hiking on the Jiri to Everest Base Camp trek and everything about the trip was impeccable. We were promptly and warmly met at the airport by the owner who then escorted us back to a good hotel, with clean beds and warm running showers (which is quite a rare commodity in Kathmandu). Starting the trek entailed a lengthy bus trip to Jiri from Kathmandu, which isn't kind on the legs but is very scenic. Even on this bus trip we were welcomed in eating with our guide in the actual kitchens of people's homes, as opposed to cafeterias - which gave us an insight into Nepali life that I'm happy to say continued to be privileged us throughout our trek.  Trekking to Base Camp from Jiri is the only way to do it and if you have the fitness (it is occasionally gruelling) and time, then you HAVE to do it this way. There are fewer people trekking, you get to spend more time with the people (as they are generally more receptive to you sitting in their kitchens when there are fewer tourists), and the scenery is just remarkable. At all points our guides and porters were really supportive and attentive to our needs, and were keen to show us the interesting bits of the various cultures.  It was in the ability of Nepal Trekking to deal with emergencies, however, that really showed the quality of their guides and porters, and the quality of the company as a whole. I was stricken with AMS (acute mountain sickness) at Lobuche and became really ill, really suddenly. As a result of the disorientation I lacked the wherewithal to realise I was dangerously sick and so I probably would have continued trekking. Our guide, however, really took control of the situation - which is exactly what you need in what is definitely a high-risk scenario. He quickly spoke with the owner (who was based in Kathmandu) who then quickly mediated with our insurance company and had an emergency helicopter scrambled for us. The care and concern I was shown by the guide and porter (and indeed many of the other guides and porters convened at Lobuche) was indeed touching and was a further credit to them and the company. The decision and rapid action of the company prevented the situation becoming severe, and I thank and commend them for that.  Overall, the owner, the guide and our porter were a pleasure to be around and took care of everything, and our safety and comfort were always their paramount concerns. In a city that fiercely competes for your custom, I couldn't recommend Nepal Hiking in stronger or warmer terms.

The kathmandu-Bhaktapur- Patan tour with guide was so amazing. Our family had a great time , we viewed all the beautiful an traditional places. We also ate great local food. The guide was really nice and friendly. Will always cherish the beautiful moments of this trip.

column7: History and Beauty Combined - Great Tour
column8: I spent 3 days touring Kathmandu City and Kathmandu Valley with Himalayan Planet Tours. They were a wonderful group to see this city and area with. I did this tour on my second day. After the hustle and bustle of the city centre it was wonderful to get out to these two fabulous UNESCO World Heritage Sites!! We went to Patan first - it was wonderful ! Every angle was picture perfect - postcard scenes !! Then we went to Bhaktapur.... so beautiful that several weddings were being held there ! Again picture perfect !! My wonderful tour guide (Som B) shared a wealth of knowledge over 3 days and always answered my questions fully. I also want to commend my driver ( Suman T) who kept my possessions safe while I toured with Som and allowed me to feel safe in an area of thousands of hectic drivers!! These two were a great team who always arrived early and ensured my safe return at the end of each day - they went above and beyond. Special Note: I was touring when the Virus CoV19 changed the world and this team and the CEO of the Himalayan Planet (Nabaraj T) assisted getting me out of the country amid chaos and confusion. They went above and beyond providing me assistance. KNOW you are in GOOD HANDS when you tour with this company ! I would also suggest any travellers still in Nepal use this group to get yourselves out... I understand they are not doing tours during this crisis but I am sure you could pay them to assist you in exiting Nepal... if anyone can do it they can !

I was picked up promptly at the airport by Rabina and started the tour straight. My guide Rabina did a great job explaining the history and culture. It was a great experience to get a feel for Kathmandu. and this tour was really good.

column7: City Tour of Bhaktapur and Patan Durbar Square
column8: Rabina (our guide) knows pretty much everything about Nepal history, culture, traditions and stories behind the History! Available to clarify everything and to take you where you really need to go! The tour is worth getting away from Kathmandu! Thanks for a day well spent!
excellent trip to Bhaktapur and Patan heritage tour with nice guide and excellent tour operator in Nepal.

places we been to Bhaktapur and Patan both were excellent for its architecture and antique aesthetic. Handicrafts and old age culture reflection architecture was the key features of the tour. touring with knowledgeable guide was another positive part of the tour.

column7: Great tour of Patan and learned lots of Nepal's history and religions
column8: We had an excellent tour of Patan with a very knowledgeable and professional tour guide, Som. We would never have known how to walk through all of the various buildings/temples without his expert guidance. We also learned a lot of the history of Patan as one of the three durbar squares and the religious aspects related to the beautiful temples and statues. A must-do tour while visiting Nepal.
It was an amazing experience. I learned alot about the history behind all the buildings and monuments.

column7: Amazing experience with a fantastic guide
column8: If you're after a day-long hike, sunrise views, culture and history then this is the trip for you!  The hike through Nagarkot was beautiful and our guide was super knowledgable of all the different cultures and traditions in the local area, he really made the day special. What was also amazing about him was that whilst by the end of the day my boots (and bum) were covered in mud, our guides shoes was spotless! After a downpour the day before I honestly don't know how he did it. Worth noting here that the local Nepalese on the tour were all lovely, friendly and happy to share their landscape - and even helped me get clean after a tumble into a puddle.  Our guide gave us the option to hike for a further two hours through the jungle after the first two hours, which we happily accepted - it was so worth it.  The Hindu temple at the end of the hike was great - dating back to 300 AD! The way that it has been restored is a testament to the skills of the local people as it has really kept its authenticity.  Needless to say, the sunrise coming up over the Himalayas was stunning, truly breakth-taking.  What was especially great about this tour was the private nature - no tour bus, just us and our private guide!!  Remember to take warm clothes for the morning and that can be stripped off for the heat of the afternoon. Also, remember $15 for breakfast at a mountainside resort.

Still recovering from the 4am start to watch the sunrise across the Kathmandu Valley and over the distant Himalayas, and a pleasant 22km hike passing through farming countryside, Brahmin, Tamang and Newari villages before Changu Narayan, a UNESCO World Heritage site. Sunrise was a bit of a fizzer, but still pretty despite the cloudy conditions. We’ll have to revisit when it’s not the wet season. Thanks to our guide Lion Ad Bidur for an unforgettable day. I would highly recommend this tour.

This hike was a lot of fun. It was great to get out of the touristy parts and see how real Nepalese people live. There were amazing views around every turn, each was more breathtaking than the last. Pankaj was our guide. He was great! His english was very good and he was very nice. He was able to answer all the questions we had about Nepal. The drive there was 1 hour, watched the sun rise for 30 minutes, breakfast at a hotel for an hour, hiking for 4 hours, then drive back. We started at 4 am and got back to our hostel at noon. Most of the hiking was Downhill so it was not too difficult. I would definitely recommend this hike to anyone!

Our guide was Bidaya and we enjoyed her explanations and conversation very much. She shared a lot with us about the historic sites we visited, the religious meanings we encountered and more genetally about life in Nepal. Patan and Bakhtapur are fascinating areas well worth a vist.
